title: How "toxic" are these chat logs?
body:
_**Game 3**_
Sollesi: why were you right behind me?
Sollesi: you just ruined everything
Sollesi: you all suck down bot
Sollesi: i did because neither of you reacted to me being there
Sollesi: so it didnt matter
Sollesi: im done
Sollesi: none of you know what you're doing
Sollesi: why wont any of you attack him?
Sollesi: why?
Sollesi: why?
Sollesi: why?
Sollesi: my god
Sollesi: this team
Sollesi: okay
Sollesi: teamm
Sollesi: where are you????
Sollesi: ??????
Sollesi: ?????????
Sollesi: ??????????????
Sollesi: holy shit
Sollesi: are you serious?
Sollesi: why did none of you move when i went in?
Sollesi: I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE
Sollesi: YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE
Sollesi: AND DID NOTHING
Sollesi: im just going to let you all deal with this
Sollesi: im done trying with you all
Sollesi: you're all the bad ones here
Sollesi: i tried
Sollesi: none of you did
Sollesi: bard top
Sollesi: is fed
Sollesi: but im the bad one
Sollesi: okay
Sollesi: and yet you dont do anything when i try to
Sollesi: you just sit ba
Sollesi: back
Sollesi: and do nothing
Sollesi: a mage should sit back and do nothing?
Sollesi: stay bronze forever
Sollesi: she doesnt
Sollesi: she has done nothing post laning
Sollesi: cant even kill ezreal
Sollesi: great job lux

I'll post the other two if anyone responds to this.

replies.body:
Honestly? Toxic enough for me to not even ask for the other two games.

You were non-stop berating your team members. And of the few lines where you weren't straight up flaming, most were passive aggressive.
Not only are you given zero context, but you aren't given timestamps, either. This was at least a 30 minute game.

I'm guessing that you, like everyone else who uses "context" as an argument, are suggesting that they were being toxic toward you, or that they were really bad, which somehow gives you the right to berate them. 

You, like everyone else who uses this argument, are wrong.

Actually only in league does context not matter if you go and shoot someone its murder.  What if there breaking into your house (i understand this varies by state) probably self defense right.  Just saying

Self defense - as the name implies - means actually attempting to protect yourself from another person's criminal action. Raging at somebody else doesn't actually fulfill that requirement because it in no way helps your situation, regardless of what that situation is.
This is where context matters. My team was essentially ignoring me and not trying to win. They are, by definition, toxic for that reason.

So being rude and obnoxious is going to help you win?

No. You are only making a bad situation worse. 

Riot is taking action based on YOUR behavior, not theirs. 

If they were truly being toxic, reporting them will cause Riot to evaluate them based on their behavior. 

You can't control them. You are only responsible for controlling yourself. You did not do that.

I tried to "help us win" by playing the game. You wouldn't know that because you are only looking at MY chat logs. You have no idea what exactly was happening in the game, and now, because people were "hurt" from what I said, I suffer the consequences, _even though_ I tried the hardest to win the game (up until the last 3 minutes).

"You are only responsible for controlling yourself. You did not do that." 

You say that like I'm actually hurting someone by getting mad at their lack of cooperation in an online video game. You, like the rest of the majority of the community, are inordinately sensitive.
Then go ahead and try to find a community where abusing and insulting others is ok. Good luck.

Abusing? You actually consider this abuse?

Wow.

You can continue putting up the "innocent act" all you want. Just admit what you said deserved your punishment already.

Unless you admit your mistake, then I won't be surprised if I ever see you make a "I got 14 days suspended/permabanned" thread in the future real soon.

The "innocent act." I have no idea what you're talking about. I already said these were my logs. I don't think I deserve punishment for typing out words that made my teammates "sad" or "hurt," but that's Riot's MO; ban people if they are mean and not fostering a community of love, happiness, sunshine and tolerance.

Oh, and I'm already perma -banned on this account.

By insulting them back, you made yourself absolutely nothing different compared to your "uncooperative" teammates. In the future, just report them next time you see anything negative done by your teammates. Spitting shit back at them will give you no benefit at all.

> Oh, and I'm already perma -banned on this account.

Explains a lot why you're making this thread with this account instead of the Sollesi account. And how were you permabanned on this one?

Technically, are you sure you're even permabanned? Your last game on this account was **an hour ago**.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/564x/79/0f/3b/790f3bc241bd437d146b377f876581cb.jpg

https://cdn.meme.am/cache/instances/folder7/34187007.jpg

No, I would argue I was at about the same level as my uncooperative teammates. I would need to report most, if not all, of my team after every game, by your logic. They are generally, by definition, toxic by not cooperating. You don't believe that statement, however, and you think they are trying their hardest and cooperating to their best ability. Unless you don't, in which case you would be agreeing with me, which would give some weight to my "flaming."

I'm pretty sure I'm perma-banned, as whenever I sign into that account, it says: "PERMANENTLY BANNED" in a pop-up window with my chat-logs as well as how I'm in the .006% of players SO TOXIC as to deserve a permanent ban.

This isn't the first time I've been perma-banned; I know the drill.
See my most recent comment.

Then you should probably have defended yourself from their toxicity by doing something that actually works: Constructive criticism without insults. What you did, didn't actually help you.

What you did, in terms of "self defense" was the equivalent of trying to protect your house from an arsonist by setting him on fire, while he's inside your house.
Not only is your response **wildly** disproportionate, you are also very very likely to make things worse.
How about on the flipside, where I ask a teammate to do something "nicely" and they refuse to?

What about it?
The fact that being nice doesn't always work doesn't make yelling at people any more effective... or tolerable.

We don't really mean context doesn't matter when we say that. What we actually mean is that there is no context where you putting a line of text into your chat that is considered toxic is ok. Since we are talking about said text, context does not matter.

If you were like, "This is text I put into my notepad to vent and it never made it into the game", then context would matter, but then Riot wouldn't have the logs. That was just the only example I can think of off the top of my head.

"Non-stop" might have been a bad choice of words here... what I mean is that most of the lines in your chat were directly berating your teammates.

And I made no judgement of the context, did I? Your third line was "you all suck down bot" which is not only devastating to the team's morale but also undeniably unconstructive harassment.

"Most" of the lines were berating? Is this: 

Sollesi: I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE
Sollesi: YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE
Sollesi: AND DID NOTHING

berating? Them refusing to cooperate is something I should be punished for in your eyes, I take it.

Really?

>Sollesi: you just ruined everything
Sollesi: you all suck down bot

isn't berating? And what about that:

>Sollesi: im done
Sollesi: none of you know what you're doing

is that not berating?

>Sollesi: you're all the bad ones here

That isn't berating either, I suppose.


Look, I could go on, but even if I couldn't give you all these other examples, if your only line of defense is "I wasn't breating them **most** of the time" you are in essence already admitting that you deserved the punishment.

> [{quoted}](name=Lesbian Lopunny,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JWhYw62F,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2017-03-09T11:40:54.791+0000)
>
> "Most" of the lines were berating? Is this: 
> 
> Sollesi: I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE
> Sollesi: YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE
> Sollesi: AND DID NOTHING
> 
> berating? Them refusing to cooperate is something I should be punished for in your eyes, I take it.

And how do you suppose that would make anyone want to listen to you?
They weren't listening to begin with. This was me telling them why I died in what was probably a 1 v 4 that could have been a 5 v 4.
No, this was you venting your frustration, nothing else.
That's a truncated version of what I just said.
No, you try to make it sound like you were right to do it. Venting your frustration at strangers is not an acceptable behavior. Never.
Acceptable behavior? There isn't a "set behavior" that people follow, and you are overestimating the emotional intelligence of humankind if you believe there is.
If you're not familiar with behavioral and social standards, ask your parents. It was their job to teach you how to behave like a decent human being.

Only one did he say his team sucked that was a little toxic i wouldnt report it but i can see why it would invoke a punishment.  The rest aint really toxic though thats the thing.  People honestly just need to learn to suck some stuff up like adults.   If me and you were playin you can say some pretty messed up things to me and i wouldnt care because your opionions dont matter enough to upset me.  Ive only lashed out at someone once and honestly i believe it was justified but that was because he was claiming to be military and said some pretty screwed up things that he never really experianced that i had.
If you paid more attention to your team not following up on your plays, instead of flaming, maybe you could have done better in this game.

I ONLY paid attention to that. That was the reason I was mad. Pinging them didn't make them decide to go in on an easy pick, or a good start to a team fight. You can't really believe that anything would have changed if I "paid more attention."

> [{quoted}](name=Lesbian Lopunny,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JWhYw62F,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-03-09T11:03:53.164+0000)
>
> _**Game 3**_
**> Sollesi: you just ruined everything
> Sollesi: you all suck down bot**

Blaming and flaming your team (it's pointless)

> Sollesi: none of you know what you&#039;re doing

I'd consider this toxic because you put yourself above them. You think you're better than them while playing in the same league as they do.

**> Sollesi: why?
> Sollesi: why?
> Sollesi: why?**

The "why" question is stupid and serves no purpose. Do you want them to give you a detailed explanation on why they died? If they know they don't need to tell you and if they don't know they don't want to know. Considering the rest of this chatlog is toxic as well I'm assuming that's what the "why" was for.

> Sollesi: where are you????
> Sollesi: ??????
> Sollesi: ?????????
> Sollesi: ??????????????

Annoying spam

> Sollesi: holy shit
> Sollesi: are you serious?
> Sollesi: why did none of you move when i went in?
> Sollesi: I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE
> Sollesi: YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE
> Sollesi: AND DID NOTHING

Sucks if you get no followup, flaming your team or even acting like you're the leader is at least annoying and 100% toxic.

> Sollesi: im just going to let you all deal with this
> Sollesi: im done trying with you all
> Sollesi: you&#039;re all the bad ones here

Flaming your team

> Sollesi: a mage should sit back and do nothing?

Lux is SUPPOSED to sit back and use her skills from the backline. She's not a frontliner.

> Sollesi: cant even kill ezreal
> Sollesi: great job lux

Well duh, Lux needs her stun to hit stuff consistently. And Ezreal has Arcane Shift.

Overall toxicity: 8/10
It could be worse, but it's **definitely** not a behavior I'd want to see in my games.

1. When I said "you all suck down bot," that was after my bot lane died twice in a row.

2. I didn't put myself above them when I said they didn't know what they were doing. My team, at that point in the game, were just running around the jungle doing nothing but dying. Clearly, they didn't know what they were doing, otherwise they wouldn't be in the jungle dying over and over again.

3. In context, the "why" was me asking a teammate didn't attack when they clearly were able to.

4. The "annoying spam" is a result of my team not helping me after I either initiated a fight, or where someone was caught out and I wanted to fight them, but my team just ran away. Context is important. 

5. Saying "I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE" AND, "YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE AND DID NOTHING" is flaming? How is it flaming when they refuse to cooperate, and when what I said was absolutely harmless and if anything, a statement of an observation? We lost because they all refused to cooperate.

6. The "flaming your team" bit was after my team repeatedly refused to cooperate, so I let our team, which was way too far behind to fight the enemy, deal with them all while I farmed.

7. When I said Lux did nothing, I literally meant she did nothing. In a teamfight, she wouldn't do anything to them. You underestimate my understanding of the game if you think I didn't know she needed to sit back. Even though she did the most damage in the game and had most kills on our team, we lost because she didn't do anything in a teamfight but inconvenience them, if anything.

8. She couldn't kill Ezreal at the end after binding and ulting him because he was so fed that he could survive her combo. That was said in reponse to her "I have 14 kills" statement. You NEED context for these. 

A score of 8 seems overly dramatic for what I said. I would give this no more than a 5.

> [{quoted}](name=Lesbian Lopunny,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JWhYw62F,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-03-09T11:52:37.382+0000)
>
> 1. When I said "you all suck down bot," that was after my bot lane died twice in a row.
>

Doesn't matter. Does telling them that they suck somehow keep them from dying?

> 2. I didn't put myself above them when I said they didn't know what they were doing. My team, at that point in the game, were just running around the jungle doing nothing but dying. Clearly, they didn't know what they were doing, otherwise they wouldn't be in the jungle dying over and over again.
> 

You make an interesting point here. Maybe instead of giving non-constructive criticism, this would be a good point for you to take charge and offer suggestions for what they should be doing.

> 3. In context, the "why" was me asking a teammate didn't attack when they clearly were able to.
> 

Isn't really all that bad of a thing to do, but simply asking "why?" is very open to interpretation and is often used and received in a very negative way. 

> 4. The "annoying spam" is a result of my team not helping me after I either initiated a fight, or where someone was caught out and I wanted to fight them, but my team just ran away. Context is important. 
>

'Annoying spam' is not very likely to encourage your teammates to assist you. In fact, it is much more likely to get them to not want to help you. It's common psychology. 

> 5. Saying "I EXPECTED YOU ALL TO MOVE" AND, "YOU ALL JUST SAT THERE AND DID NOTHING" is flaming? How is it flaming when they refuse to cooperate, and when what I said was absolutely harmless and if anything, a statement of an observation? We lost because they all refused to cooperate.
> 

All caps is generally received as aggressive, and used in a way that comes across as a command is often taken as belittling. 

> 6. The "flaming your team" bit was after my team repeatedly refused to cooperate, so I let our team, which was way too far behind to fight the enemy, deal with them all while I farmed.
>

Again, context doesn't really matter when trying to justify why you said what you said because it is ultimately non-constructive, and is more likely to cause a negative response. However, given the context that you are providing, you acknowledge that they are too far behind to deal with the enemy, therefor they needed you to help them instead of farming. 
 
> 7. When I said Lux did nothing, I literally meant she did nothing. In a teamfight, she wouldn't do anything to them. You underestimate my understanding of the game if you think I didn't know she needed to sit back. Even though she did the most damage in the game and had most kills on our team, we lost because she didn't do anything in a teamfight but inconvenience them, if anything.
> 

You're really contradicting yourself here. If she was dealing the most damage and had the most kills (which would suggest that she wasn't simply ks-ing) then she is clearly not "doing nothing". She may not be doing what is best in the given situation, but again, your comments are not constructive. I honestly think this should be the lesson you take from this. Instead of making a statement that such as "You're doing nothing", try making a suggestion for what they should do. However, keep in mind that you are not their boss, or their elected leader. If you make suggestions in a friendly, constructive way, people are far more likely to work with you. 

> 8. She couldn't kill Ezreal at the end after binding and ulting him because he was so fed that he could survive her combo. That was said in reponse to her "I have 14 kills" statement. You NEED context for these. 
> 

Context would be more helpful for this final bit, but I don't really see them as being as being all that negative by themselves either. 

> A score of 8 seems overly dramatic for what I said. I would give this no more than a 5.

I wouldn't have given you a score because that isn't my job. That is for Riot to ultimately determine. 

What I am trying to do here is to help you to understand how I see your behavior. You don't have to take my input, but I would assume that this is why you came to the boards. (Actually, I would assume that you came here thinking that you would get more support, but the community is generally very negative toward people who post chat logs because we see them all the time, .. and they are usually toxic)

You see my behavior as pointless rage typing (that I am more than cognizant of), and that I should be "more constructive" instead of "flaming," even though your definition of "flame" is vague and ambiguous. 

I will bet you money that if, instead of saying: "you are worthless," I said: "try to avoid his stun, and don't be pushed up too far without vision," I would be reported. Why? Because they'll find it pretentious. They "know what they're doing," and my "advice" isn't advice to them; it's passive-aggression. The absolute last thing someone wants to be told is that they are doing something wrong, so giving them "advice" equals flame (that's elementary psychology). I can't say if this applies to anywhere higher than bronze elo, as my teammates make sure I don't climb by never cooperating, but I can assume they are more "open-minded," if you will, at higher ranks.
Then dont say anything, ever, ... or don't be surprised when you get banned ... again

> [{quoted}](name=Lesbian Lopunny,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JWhYw62F,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-03-09T11:52:37.382+0000)
> A score of 8 seems overly dramatic for what I said. I would give this no more than a 5.

That's also the reason you got punished. You don't think it's toxic while it actually is.
Like I said. It could be worse, overall it's pretty toxic though.
I don't think this is anywhere near the highest level of toxicity. Not even just in League.
Also, just because you only got three game logs doesn't mean you were punished for just three.
Why was I shown 3 then?

> [{quoted}](name=Lesbian Lopunny,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JWhYw62F,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2017-03-10T13:55:10.092+0000)
>
> Why was I shown 3 then?

3 is the maximum the system shows.

Plot Twist: the OP is actually masochistic and a glutton for punishment; already permabanned on two accounts and arguing on the boards about how saintly he is and "not toxic, just wanted my retarded teammates to listen to me I know best!".

At what point did I say on the boards: "I am not toxic."?

I'll await the quote.
Extremely toxic, if you got muted for this, then it was well deserved.
No, I was permanently banned on this account because of this and the two others they showed me.

how toxic are thee logs specifically?

3.5/10 probably, but if done consistently will get you punished. Before you scream that it's mild and shouldn't count towards you punishment, anything more than 0 will get you punished if done consistent enough.

It's in your logs cos it is a valid report against you, so Riot shows you as an example that such behavior isn't acceptable.
